result.execSummary:
All charges against Steven E Corstvet in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven E Corstvet is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Steven E Corstvet in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim appears in person.
Case called for jury status hearing.
State has complied with victim's rights. 
State had made an offer. The refusal of the offer resulted in new charges being filed (22CF1261). 
State places refused offer on the record.
Defendant advises the court he would like to accept the offer at this point. 
Court passes the case to allow Defense time to fill out plea paperwork. 

11:41 AM Case is recalled. Defendant Steven E Corstvet in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has refused the offer and requests an adjournment of trial.
Atty Gutierrez assures the court he has not spoken with the victim. 
Court dismisses this case without prejudice.

Court conducts an Initial Appearance in 22CF1261.
Defense acknowledges receipt of Complaint and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Court sets signature bond with conditions. 
Defense waives time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Trial Order signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow 06/27/2022.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense requests trial date as parties have not come to resolution.  Court sets matter on trial calendar.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defense requests a plea and sentencing date, but would like some time to negotiate.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Luis Gutierrez has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Hearing on February 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on February 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.    Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.   CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The Defendant to report to WCS by end of business on Friday, 01/28/2022.

08:59 AM Defendant Steven E Corstvet in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared in court.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  

The Court recesses at 09:03 AM for the Defendant to be evaluated by the SPD.
The Court recalls the matter at 09:18 AM with the same appearances.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Victim A presents bail statements.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
